titles: A divine pater-noster (by way of reply to a scandalous ode, or pamphlet made by a manelesse author, who had more wit then honesty.)
publisher: Printed for Thomas Underhill, and are to be sold at his shop, the signe of the Bible in Woodstreete,
notes: In verse, with the Our Father interpolated between couplets.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Dissenters, Religious --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
